description: A Thanksgiving-worthy tart made with pears, dried figs, and a hazelnut crust.
name: Pear and Dried Fig Tart
recipeIngredient: 13 Tablespoons cold unsalted butter (cut into cubes)
3 pears (ripe but firm(about 1 1/2 pounds), peeled and thinly sliced)

recipeInstructions.text: Place all of the dry ingredients into the bowl of a food processor and pulse until combined. Scatter the butter over the dry ingredients. Pulse until the butter is in small pieces with some larger pieces. While pulsing, pour the beaten egg through the feed hole and continue pulsing just until the dough starts to hold together. Turn out of the bowl onto a clean surface and press the dough together into one large ball. Divide the dough into two pieces, one slightly larger than the other. Form the smaller one into a disk shape and wrap tightly with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge to chill for 30 minutes.
Grease the bottom and sides of a tart pan with removable bottom. Take the larger piece of dough and press it into the tart pan. Cover with plastic wrap and place in fridge or freezer for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Have a parchment-lined, rimmed baking sheet ready.
